answers.author: Christine Edwards
answers.text:
The City of charlotte has the City Manager's Awards. It recognizes employees for outstanding work done in the previous year. They take nominations in the following categories: Embracing Change • Community Ambassadorship • Inspiration
Innovation • Outstanding Work & Employee of the Year

answers.author: Vickie Atkinson
answers.text:
The City of Durham’s employee recognition program, STARs, rewards employees who demonstrate the organization’s core values. The program is simple, costs little, and is very successful. Through a program that showcases doing the right thing, hundreds of employees have been recognized over the past ten years.  I've attached a more complete description of the program

answers.author: Sam Anselm
answers.text:
We do not have a formal recognition program (and I'd be reluctant to suggest one for a number of reasons), however we do have a display board at city hall where supervisors or employees can give "kudos" to other employees for a job well done. On occasion we will also publish items in our city newsletter, or recognize an employee at a council meeting if he/she has gone above and beyond in their work.

author: Catherine Tkachyk
text: The City of San Antonio is looking to implement a new Employee Recognition Program.  We are looking for examples of any programs that have worked well in your organization as well as any ideas on how to get the program started strong.  Thanks!
title: Employee Recognition Program
